simulator

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulator.Config

  • public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    The class manages the configuration and running of a simulation.

    It collates the hardware components: clock, cpu, and I/O devices. Classes such as concrete Kernels can access these components here.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addDevice(IODevice device)
      Add an IODevice to the configuration.
      static void buildConfiguration(java.lang.String filename)
      Complete the simulation configuration by uploading the given config file.
      static CPU getCPU()
      Obtain the CPU used in the current configuration.
      static IODevice getDevice(int ID)
      Obtain the IODevice with the given ID.
      static SystemTimer getSystemTimer()
      Obtain the SystemTimer used in the current configuration.
      static void init(Kernel kernel, int cSwitchCost, int sysCallCost)
      Create an initial simulation configuration that uses the given kernel, context switch cost and system call cost.
      static void run()
      Run the configured simulation (the init() and buildConfiguration() methods must be called first).

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
